title: Tony Abbott still claims he's lily-white
text:
Live by the sword, die by the sword. In the world of federal politics, Tony Abbott did little out of the ordinary in working to undermine Malcolm Turnbull, the man who'd ousted him and whom he had ousted years earlier.

But who does Abbott think he's fooling with his continued insistence that he's never worked with journalists towards any rival's demise?!?

In a long interview with The Australian's Troy Bramston published on Monday, Abbott claims he had "never given to a journalist information about someone else which is designed to damage another person".

Funny then that over a cosy dinner in Canberra with the same paper's Simon Benson, Abbott suggested ways the national affairs editor could expose party members who thought someone other than Abbott should represent the residents of Warringah in parliament (before the citizens of Warringah took the matter out of Liberal hands).

As we revealed back in February, one diner seated close to the pair clearly overheard Abbott explaining how three Liberal Party Warringah branch members were working against him, before agreeing with Benson's suggestion that they should be expelled from the party. "Call Alex Dore," Abbott suggested to Benson. "But don't mention my name ... Make it sound more general."

Funnily enough, in the same interview with Bramston, Abbott also declares himself "a big fan of democratisation of the NSW Liberal Party". Just not in his own branch ...
description: Who does Abbott think he's fooling with his continued insistence that he's never worked with journalists to undermine a rival?
